snippet: Two 19th century nuns from Ottoman-ruled Palestine were made saints at a ceremony in St. Peter’s Square on Sunday, just days after the Vatican recognized Palestinian statehood.
abstract: Pope Francis canonizes Sister Mariam Baouardy and Sister Marie Alphonsine Ghattas, two 19th-century nuns from Ottoman-ruled Palestine; move is seen as bid of support for Palestine sovereignty, as well as means of encouraging both Middle Eastern Christians and women.
lead_paragraph: Two 19th century nuns from Ottoman-ruled Palestine were made saints at a ceremony in St. Peter’s Square on Sunday, just days after the Vatican recognized Palestinian statehood.

headline.main: Two Arab Nuns From Palestine Are Canonized by Pope Francis
headline.print_headline: Two Arab Nuns From Palestine Are Canonized by Francis
